org.swisscheese.swisscheese.game

Class GameLoop

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.swisscheese.swisscheese.game.GameLoop
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable

    public final class GameLoop
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Runnable
    Main class of the 3D portion of the game. This class is only responsible for running the game, and does not do other features like collecting user settings or starting the game.

    This class calls other components of the game such as the Window to update, while limiting the FPS to avoid the physics from varying between computers and for efficient use of computer resources.

    Since:
    2018-12-10, v0.2
    Version:
    v1.0
    Author:
    Alex Kalinins

    • Constructor Detail

      • GameLoop

        public GameLoop(java.awt.Dimension dimension,
                boolean fitToScreen,
                TexturePack texture,
                float FRAME_RATE,
                float FOV,
                Map map,
                SaveMetadata metadata,
                UseRenderer useRenderer,
                View... view)
        Constructor of GameLoop
        Parameters:
        dimension - the dimension of the Window in which the game will display.
        fitToScreen - true if the Window size will be the same as that of the user's monitor. If true dimension is disregarded.
        texture - the object that contains all textures that the game will be using.
        FRAME_RATE - the frame-rate to which the frame-rate of the game will be limited. Measured as frames per second.
        FOV - the field of view of the player.
        map - the map in which the player is placed.
        metadata - the metadata required for saving the game.
        view - Optional variable used only when a saved game is being opened.
